review_title: SUPER fun! better than Beat Saber!
one_reviews_text:
man, have I had my fair share of rhythm games, friday night funkin', guitar hero, RB4, beat saber, the list goes on and on, but none have surprised me (in terms of overall quality) as much as pistol whip does! For starters, you don't have to buy any songs, so you have the entire game when you buy it, crossbuy, so I can play it on my pc too! Graphics are HIGH for a quest 2 standard, and I never see lag. Campaign is really fun and cool (both 2089 and smoke & thunder). And the modifier combos are endless, with many cool guns, replayability is higher than any game I ever played, that says something because most rhythm games have none of this stuff! So, what does PW have to offer? FAST paced gameplay? hard-to-beat opponents? so many notes you are going to break your arms?? Nope, it offers fun gameplay, levels that are SPECIFICALLY tailored to the song theme, progressive difficulty, and an overall good time. So, should you buy pistol whip?
Yup, it is a relief over all other rhythm games that try to kill you after breaking your arms, not letting you enjoy the music, going at breakneck speeds, so, purchase this game, and have fun bopping fully armored men with guns, and enjoy pistol whip!
I AM NEO

VR is awesome. 
You know what's better than that? A good game in VR; the sort of thing that makes you grit your teeth, sway all over the place and scream with frustrated delight. Pistol Whip is an experience; a wonderful, beautiful journey into the baser instincts of man and our relentless desire to pull the trigger on anything that moves....

I'm an older gamer, Pong, Manic miner and all that, so it's an absolute joy to have this immersive rollercoaster. It reminds me of the old arcade machine "Operation Wolf" except "Pistol Whip" lets you get into the console...

I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys trigger action. There's a great choice of pace and difficulty each with their own sense of reward. 

 Pistol Whip is a refined vision, best served with auto-aim off. 

Wonderful. Thank you for the endless grins.

This was an excellent game when it was just a couple of tracks that the devs made levels around. Now, we have a campaign (2089) comprised of five levels where the marriage of music to gameplay is so sublimely cinematic and heart-pounding, it's unironically my favorite VR experience since Half-Life: Alyx. There is character progression, gamplay diversity, great setpieces and a fantastic boss in this one little package. Go play it.

Update: Blood and Thunder is even better. This is a quality video game.

Congratulations to your team for putting together the best version of Pistol Whip I could ever imagine. I absolutely LOVE the fact that you can mix and match every aspect of the game and gameplay. I've been waiting for what seems like forever for this update and it didn't disappoint. Thanks again for your effort, you've made my favorite game even better!

Been using this game for months, due to being a low-poly non-textured Quest port, this game has extremely low hardware requirements - well, Quest does have the same gpu as the old Samsung S8 phone. 
However, this means that you can activate extremely high levels of super sampling (ss) to get the most amazing image quality. I can use ss 2.5 with my CV1 and still get solid 90 fps - just using a GTX 1080. 
Sound is awesome using CV1, even much better than the Index. The gameplay is very repetitive - you constanly shoot same kinds of men, never any big monsters (or boss fights) - but still great fun.

It gets your heart rate up from the physical activity and has a high replay value. In my mind it is a must own for anyone who like shooting and rhythm games.

review_title: Fantastic game, and good for exercise
one_reviews_text: This game easily has the most fun gameplay I've experienced in VR, and I can't wait for the songs they will add over time to play through more of them. It makes you feel like a real bad*ss. I decided to try to turn this into more of a fitness game while finding ways to get cardio in during the lockdown, and I figured out I could get my heart rate up super high by playing this with a weight vest on (64 lbs) while not noticing nearly as much struggling when hitting similar levels on a trackmill or bike. It was more effective than my usual pace on my rowing machine while feeling just as sustainable over periods of a half-hour plus. I wouldn't recommend doing this unless you're very familiar with weight vest workouts AND the game, but if you are this is the most fun you can have getting solid cardio and a decent core workout in.
Don't debate it, just but this game! This is the game I let everyone who wants to try my Quest start with.

review_title: Way more fun than it has any right to be
one_reviews_text:
I was pretty excited for Pistol Whip, though as with any VR game you never know until you try it. But I've put a heap of time into it now (having finished all the songs on Easy and Normal, starting hard now) and I am absolutely loving it. I can see this becoming a staple game that I play over and over just like  Beat Saber, and I think that as long as they add content over time it will have the same sort of staying power.

A lot of really smart decisions were made when making PW. Not only does the fact that its on rails help tremendously with focus and managing any issues with locomotion-based VR sickness, you only have to aim roughly at the enemies. This means you can focus on having fun and planning your next shot rather than having to line up careful headshots. As you get into a groove, you will naturally get more accurate, and then you get more points for better shots. If you get shot, you only have to avoid being shot again (or hitting a wall) for a short period to get back to full health, ensuring that its fun and challenging, without ever feeling impossible.

Honestly, I cannot recommend this game enough. I really hope they add a heap more content as time goes on, but even as it is, for the asking price, this is a no brainer and one of the best VR experiences I've had to date.

review_title: Ignore the other reviews. BUY IT.
one_reviews_text:
This review is going to counter the top rated 2 star review.
Okay Listen,
For the people complaining about the game being too hard because enemies spawn already opening fire at you - if you remember correctly, old arcade games were virtually un-beatable, and un saveable. You either were good enough to beat them and get your name on the scoreboard, or you lose your money and go home.  This game feels like this (on hard mode) but they have an easy mode, and a no fail option.

-There is an option to turn off the setting where it tells you to go to the center of the area.

Seriously though,
If you are a fan of Electronic/Dubstep/bass music - John Wick / The Matrix / - Beat Saber and Super Hot, it's like all of those elements had a baby and this is the outcome. It's insanely fun. I played the game for 2 hrs straight, and I can't wait until more content/maps/songs are released.  I enjoyed every second.

You dip/duck under bullets and walls so frequently, i never even realized I was doing an intense squat themed leg workout until i realized i couldn't walk up the stairs when I was done.  I'm not kidding, I'm still sore.

The game is well worth the money just to be able to show it as a first-time VR shooter. You can easily throw it on easy mode or no fail and anybody would have a blast just being in the environment and ducking under bullets.  

You do, however, have to change the "dual wield" function in the options, it's not default, so I have actually been playing like that for a lower score just because it's way more fun to do.  If I ever try to top the scoreboards, I'll go the single style.

If the devs end up reading this, the only thing I would like to see in the future is maybe a few maps that incorporate turns around corners, or possibly heigh/speed changes (ie, elevators, flights of stairs, Jumping off of a roof, etc)
other than that, I love it with all of my heart. Jumping into medium/hard really does make you feel like John Wick.

This game is so addicting, fun, and definetly will get your blood pumping. It's like a combination of Audica, Super Hot, and Beat Saber in the best way! I can't wait to see what the developers will do next with this game. Hopefully some new songs soon :)

Since Beat Saber I wasn't able to find a good alternative. Yes, I loved Lone Echo but truly, there is no other game like Beat Saber, a game that keep you going and going no matter what.  I was able to master it to Expert+ level and even getting an "S"  on most tracks.  My arms feel so much stronger after months of practice....  that is until Pistol Whip.

This game will do to your legs what beat saber does to your arms, it's almost the perfect complement !

No other game makes you excercise and have so much fun like this one.

This game is now second on my TOP list for MUST HAVE VR games after Beat Saber.

You CANNOT skip this one.   Also,  plays exactly the same on the Quest so it's a must buy if you have one, the other or both.

Gameplay wise it's just perfect.  Yes, it does have aim assist but even then it's hard as hell in hard difficulty. 

This game coupled with beat saber is the perfect Gym !.

Rift S V's Quest Comparison Video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=h2kvawkk9CE

My Initial Impressions:
Pistol Whip is a unique rhythm shooter that will not appeal to everyone and you'll need to be reasonably fit to get the most out of it.
Satisfaction also comes in the form of getting off those shots in time to the beat.
ALSO I think this game has not QUITE reached its potential yet!
I would like to see a Campaign mode, some more 'Dance Style' tracks and other modes like Speed Trials etc. So hopefully the devs will continue to build and make this game even better.
I do think this is a unique game and I also think it will opened up a new genre for VR.
PS. Having played both the Rift S and Quest version, I think I prefer the Quest version due to the freedom element, ie no cable and there really is no graphical hit playing on the Quest.

one_reviews_text: This is easily my new go-to "You have to check out this VR thing" game when introducing VR to family & friends.  Previously was Beat Saber and/or Superhot.  It's a total rush with so much subtle depth.  The more I dig into it and learn how to coordinate and feel out the music for higher points (while being very tactical when to pistol whip), the more I love it.  And I haven't even dove into Hard mode or Deadeye yet.  So much more awaits.  I can't wait to dive back in.

I keep hearing comparisons to Beat Saber and Superhot, or if they had a baby you would get Pistol Whip, and I get that... but in my mind that baby then got up and walked it’s own path because Pistol Whip is a unique Action gun game with great music. Keep to the Rhythm to score big but sometimes thats the risk for reward because this game is very challenging and a very good work out. Great soundtrack, loads of replay ability, modifiers and future DLC to come. VR is the only way this type of game is possible and I can’t recommend this enough. If your looking gameplay be it in Mixed Reality or on Oculus Quest just search Gamertag VR.

This is a great game, loads of fun to play.  The menus are really unreliable though.  I've had many cases where I try to shoot the menu options to select them and it doesn't respond at all.  I had it where both the retry and exit buttons at the end of a game were unresponsive.  That issue definitely needs to get ironed out, the menus need to work all the time without fail.  Once that happens I'll be glad to give 5 stars but this game is too broken to even give 4 with those problems present unfortunately.

The game is a lot of fun and very polished. It's the best game I've bought since Beat Saber and time will tell if it's better.

Edit - A few comments on other reviews:

You can turn off the notification you get from stepping out of your play space if you don't like it.

Enemy bullets have multiple rings around them, move slowly, and buzz if they get near you, so you shouldn't have trouble discearning them from the background.

Aim is a big part of the score. You get more points with more accurate aiming. If you want to emphasize aim even more you can turn off autoaim.

There's an effect that appears before an enemy spawns if they spawn on-screen.
Performance is awful across the board. Before the holidays was a bad move.
